ovdesc.p: A file that holds the details about the failed CAMT message
This table will contain the details for both CAMT052 and CAMT053 messages
It will get updated whenever there is a problem encountered during generation of CAMT message

desc.p: Id will be in the format of ACCOUNT-STMTDATE.FREQUENCY.COMPANYCODE-MESSAGETYPE
Message Type will be either CAMT052 or CAMT053
It will be same as that of AC.XML.STMT.DATA id
When CAMT is generated for multiple recipients there will be a sequence number appended after message type in the id
Value can be ERROR or SUCCESS
The value "ERROR" denotes that the CAMT message has not been generated
The value "SUCCESS" indicates that the CAMT message has been generated on the resubmission
This field is used to resubmit the CAMT request for the messages that had failed
Inputtable only for the XML.TRANFORM error
Value can either be null or YES

p.strong: Date of resubmission of CAMT request

desc.p: Holds the date on which the CAMT request was resubmitted
Source of the error which caused the CAMT message to fail
Value can be DATA.ASSEMBLY, INTERFACE, XML.TRANSFORM
DATA.ASSEMBLY indicates that the value for mandatory tags had been missing
XML.TRANSFORM indicates XML transformation error which may occur due to error in the XSLT
Message that conveys in detail the reason for the failure of CAMT message generation
Name of the Tag which had some problem due to which CAMT was not generated
Error associated with the tag specified above which led to the unsuccessful CAMT generation
Date on which CAMT request was given
